abstracts.cdata!:
The Trade Policy and Export Development
            Loan will support the Government's efforts to reform
            trade and export policies with the objective of increasing
            domestic output and restructuring the productive base of the
            economy in order to reduce its dependence on the oil sector
            and on imports. With this in mind, the loan will support
            specific policy reforms such as (i) introduction of a
            market-determined exchange rate system; (ii) elimination of
            trade restrictions and price controls; and (iii)
            implementation of a package of export incentives. The loan
            will provide US$450 million equivalent to finance general
            imports of goods and US$2 million equivalent to finance
            technical assistance and training for export development and
            subsector investment studies. These reforms are being
            undertaken in the context of a structural adjustment program
            recently approved by the Government.
